description.narrative: IOM will continue food-aid project previously coordinated by the Red Cross Curacao, by way of a cash-based COVID-19 response. The leading modality for this project will remain cash-based intervention, through distribution of e-voucher debit cards. With the aim to balance the beneficiaries’ expectations with the prospected outcome of the project, IOM endeavors to continue the process, as it was set-up by the Red Cross, as much as possible. The project aims to reach two key-outputs. IOM intends to centralize registration of new beneficiaries through a hotline, managed by way of an implementing partnership. The purpose of the hotline is to register beneficiaries for the cash-based COVID-19 response providing overall support. Individual agreements with all NGOs involved in populating the database, might be a prerequisite to continue building on the Curaçao Help database. The aim is also to distribute the e-voucher cards at various intervals throughout the duration of the project, this to allow continuous registering of potentially new beneficiaries.

participating-org.narrative: Netherlands - Ministry of the Interior and Kingdom Relations

sector.narrative: Protection and Assistance to Vulnerable Migrants

policy-marker.narrative: Project with some but insufficient inclusion of gender issues
